isis.stitle: CAB: 7000 AND 8000 SERIES MODELS - REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION - Cab Air Suspension System

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve, it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

step1.para: Drain air from the air system.
Remove supply air line from height control valve.
Loosen compression nut and remove air spring air line.
Remove linkage from ball pivot.
Remove two mounting bolts and lock nuts from height control valve.
Remove height control valve from mounting bracket.

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after servicing is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

item.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve, it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

Inspect height control valve for proper alignment. The drive bearing notch on the rear side of drive bearing must be on the supply side of the valve labeled SUPP. If not, loosen pan head bearing screw, but do not remove, and pull height control valve arm loose from drive bearing. Rotate drive bearing until drive bearing notch is in correct position, then secure height control valve lever by tightening pan head bearing screw. Tighten screw to 40 to 50 Lbf-in. (5 to 6 N•m).

step1.para: Install height control valve on mounting bracket ( Figure 143, Items 4 and 6).
Install two mounting bolts and lock nuts ( Figure 143, Items 2 and 5). Tighten lock nuts to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).
Attach linkage to ball pivot ( Figure 143, Items 7 and 8).
Attach air spring air line and secure with compression nut ( Figure 143, Items 1 and 9). Hand tighten compression nut and then turn another 450 to 630 degrees.

Attach supply air line to the height control valve by pressing firmly in and ensure it is locked into position ( Figure 143, Items 1 and 6). Pull on supply air line to verify it is locked securely into the height control valve.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab ride height. Refer to
Cab Air Suspension
.

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

item.para: Both front and rear shock absorbers remove the same.
Some models may have a different configuration from that shown. The procedures are the same.

step1.para: Remove two bolts and two lock nuts from the shock absorber.
Remove shock absorber from between cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

item.para: Both front and rear shock absorbers remove the same.
Some models may have a different configuration from that shown. The procedures are the same.

step1.para: Install shock absorber between cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate ( Figure 144, Items 1, 3, and 4).
Secure the shock absorber with two bolts and two lock nuts ( Figure 144, Items 2, 3, and 5). Tighten lock nuts to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

step1.para: Drain air from the air system.
Loosen compression nuts on fittings and disconnect air lines.
Unthread fittings from air springs (bags).

note.para: Retaining rings will be damaged upon removal. New retaining rings are supplied with the new air springs (bags).

step1.para: Pry retaining rings from top of air springs (bags) and remove.
Remove screw from the bottom of each air springs (bags).
Compress air springs (bags) and remove.

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

note.para: New retaining rings are supplied with the new air springs (bags).

step1.para: Install air springs (bags) and attach new retaining rings to the top ( Figure 145, Items 4 and 5).
Install screw to the bottom of each air spring ( Figure 145, Items 5 and 6). Tighten screw to 2 to 4 Lbf-ft (3 to 5 N•m).

Apply pipe thread sealant to threads of the fittings and reinstall into top of air springs ( Figure 145, Items 3 and 5). Hand tighten the fittings until snug, and then turn another 270 to 450 degrees.
Connect air lines to fittings ( Figure 145, Items 1and 3). Hand tighten the compression nuts, and then turn another 450 to 630 degrees.
Build up air pressure and check air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab ride height. Refer to
Cab Air Suspension
.

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

step1.para: Remove bolt and lock nut from lateral control rod and cab mounting plate.
Remove bolt and lock nut from lateral control rod and crossmember mounting plate.
Remove lateral control rod.

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

step1.para: Install lateral control rod ( Figure 146, Item 1).
Install bolt and lock nut through lateral control rod and crossmember mounting plate ( Figure 146). Tighten nut to 70 to 90 Lbf-ft (95 to 122 N•m).
Install bolt and lock nut through lateral control rod and cab mounting plate ( Figure 146). Tighten nut to 70 to 90 Lbf-ft (95 to 122 N•m).
Remove bolt and locknut from jounce bumper.
Remove jounce bumper from underneath cab mounting plate.
Position jounce bumper underneath cab mounting plate ( Figure 147, Items 1 and 4).
Install bolt and lock nut ( Figure 147, Items 2 and 3). Tighten lock nut to 2 to 4 Lbf-ft (3 to 5 N•m).
